title: Just eff my CPU up, Riot.
body:
Try installing League of Legends.

Download LeagueofLegends_OC1_Installer_06_11_13.exe through a downloader that lets me resume from where I left off if I need to close it.

This isn't the main game, though, the main game has to be downloaded through THEIR downloader/installer that makes me start from zero if I need to close it.

Why? How long has this been an issue for?

Not only that, but NO client should need FOUR PROCESSES taking up nearly HALF my computer's processing power and HALF A GIGABYTE of memory. Jesus Christ.

Why hasn't this been fixed?

I'm guessing the answer is the same as the answer to 'why does Riot release new champions instead of balancing what exists?'

Money.

replies.body:
Get a better CPU.
There is no way in hell those should use up that much of your computer's strength.

I use a sweet i7 HEXCORE. Gets any job I want done, done.
Not to mention I've yet to come across a process that breaks past 5% of my usage.
